custom_expected:

title: As a user, I want an amateur (domestic or international) player to be removed from the partner roster upon signing a new contract
custom_expected:
Upon signing an amateur player (type 5 or 6) who is on a partner roster to a contract, the player should be removed from that roster and there should be a history item added for them (activity is Removed/MLB Signing).  

For minor contracts this happens at terms accepted state (SGNMN transaction) and for major contracts its upon approval of the Sign To Major League Roster transaction (created behind the scenes by MJC upon terms confirmed, but also can be created manually)

AC:
* When an amateur (type 5 or 6) player is signed to a contract they will be removed from any partner portal roster
* There will be a new history item added for the player with activity of Removed/MLB Signing

title: As a user, I want a Partner Portal Type (8) player with a non domestic birth country who signs a minor league contract to be considred an international player
custom_expected:
Upon signing a Partner Portal Type (type eight) player with a non domestic birth country (anything but US, Canada, PR, Guam, VI) to an international minor league contract the player will appear as an international player
(international_player_flag will be true)

For minor contracts this happens at terms accepted state (in the SGNMN transaction) 

AC:
* When SGNMN or SGNXT transaction for type 8 player with a non domestic birth country is approved (mnc moved to terms accepted) the player will be listed as an international player
* Professional profile for the player will have the international tab

title: As a user, I want a Partner Portal Type (8) player with a domestic birth country who signs a minor league contract to be considred a passed over player
custom_expected:
Upon signing a Partner Portal Type (type eight) player with a domestic birth country (US, Canada, PR, Guam, VI) to a domestic minor league contract the player will appear as passed over in the most recent draft.

For minor contracts this happens at terms accepted state (in the SGNMN transaction) 

AC:
* When SGNMN or SGNXT transaction for type 8 player with a domestic birth country is approved (mnc moved to terms accepted) the player will be listed as a passed over player
* Professional profile for the player will have the draft page and will have a line item for 'passed over' in the most recent draft

title: As a User, I want a Partner Portal Type player to become a professional player upon signing them to a contract
custom_expected:
Upon signing a partner portal type player (type = 8 ) to a contract, the player should become a professional player.  If the player was on a partner portal roster, they should be removed from that roster and there should be a history item added for them (activity is Removed/MLB Signing).  Any contact info entered into the parter portal profile will be carried forward onto their new professional profile.

For minor contracts this happens at terms accepted state (SGNMN transaction) and for major contracts its upon approval of the Sign To Major League Roster transaction (created behind the scenes by MJC upon terms confirmed, but also can be created manually)

AC:
* When a partner portal type player (type eight) is signed to a contract they will become a professional player (person type is now 2)
* If the player was on a partner portal roster, they will be removed from that roster
* If the player was on a partner portal roster, there will be a new history item added for the player with activity of Removed/MLB Signing
* Contact info entered on the partner portal will be carried forward onto the new professional profile

title: As a user, I want a minor contract created for a Partner Portal type player to use contact info from the partner portal contact info tables
custom_expected:
New minor contracts created for a partner portal player will pull contact info from the partner portal contact info tables.  The info will appear on the contract in the Summary section (Permanent Street Address and City, State, Zip fields) as well as on the printed contract in the addendum A section.  

Additionally all appropriate bio information should be displayed on the printed contract (though this should not require any changes as we're storing them in the same place as the pro player).

AC
* For a Partner Portal Type player - Contact info will be pulled from the partner portal into a newly created minor contract 
* Info will also displayed correctly when printing the contract.

title: As a User, when creating a new minor contract for a Partner Portal type player I want the system to correctly determine which type of contract it should be
custom_expected:
Upon creation of a minor contract for a player who is ONLY entered into the partner portal and was not a prior existing ebis player (person type id is equal to eight) I want the system to decide which type of minor contract should be created: Domestic or International.  In order to decide, the playerâ€™s birth country will be used.  If the player was born in the US, Canada, Puerto Rico or Guam then the contract should be considered a domestic contract.  For any other country, the contract will be considered international.  All contracts created for these players will be considered first year contracts - there will be no non first year.

AC:

* When a partner league player has an approved request in the PL Request widget, Club users will have the ability to create a new contract.
* If the user chooses to create a new MNC, the playerâ€™s birth country will determine which type of contract is created:
** US, Canada, Puerto Rico or Guam: 1st Year Domestic
** Any other birth country: 1st Year International

title: Set up Partner Portal in OKTA
custom_expected:
Work with InfoSec to set up Partner Portal in OKTA / APP and Group / LDAP Integration rule for Club users
Work with InfoSec to set up Partner Portal in App Store. Assign Administrators.

title: As an ebis user, I want to be prevented from submitting a contract for a player who is on a partner portal roster
custom_expected:
Upon attempting to submit either a major, a minor OR a sign to major league roster transaction we will check to see if the player in question is on a partner league roster.  If they are, we will additionally check to see if there is an existing. approved partner league request for that player and for the corresponding org.

If there is no request, the user will receive a the following message:
This player is currently on a Partner League roster and requires an approved request before signing.

Please contact the BOC.

This will be a hard error for clubs and a warning for BOC

AC:

* An approved partner league request for the specified org is required for submission of a minor contract for a player who is on a partner league roster
* An approved partner league request for the specified org is required for submission of a major contract for a player who is on a partner league roster
* An approved partner league request for the specified org is required for submission of a sign to major league roster for a player who is on a partner league roster
* If none is found, a message is displayed:
*BODY:* This player is currently on a Partner League roster and requires an approved request before signing.

Please contact the BOC.

* Message will be a hard error for club users
* Message will be overridable for BOC users

title: As an ebis user, I want signing a former MLB player who is on a partner roster to a new contract to update their profile
custom_expected:
After a request is approved and accepted for a professional player currently on a partner portal roster signing them to a major or minor contract should remove them from the partner portal (adding a remove from roster item) and they should appear on their new club.

For minor contracts this happens at terms accepted state (SGNMN transaction) and for major contracts its upon approval of the Sign To Major League Roster transaction (created behind the scenes by MJC upon terms confirmed, but also can be created manually)

AC:

* Pro player on a partner portal roster is removed from partner roster and appears on mlb club roster after moving a new MNC to terms accepted.
* Pro player on a partner portal roster is removed from partner roster and appears on mlb club roster after approving the sign to major league roster transaction
* A Remove/MLB Signing activity is added to the partner portal activity list and to the player's history.

title: As a BOC user, I want to see and edit the email addresses for partner portal users
custom_expected:
Add the users email address to the partner portal users screen in ebis when viewing a user.

The field should be editable when the screen is in edit mode and saved upon clicking save.

AC:
* User's email address is visible on the Partner Portal Users page
* User's email address is editable on the Partner Portal Users page
* User's email is saved upon clicking save on the Partner Portal Users page

title: As a BOC user, on the partner portal users page in EBIS, I want to see which league a user belongs
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a user in the partner portal users utility in EBIS, I want to see which league they belong to
custom_expected:
THEN viewing a single user will display the league name that the user is president of for any league presidents on the partner portal users page
AND viewing a club user will display the league name in the league dropdown

title: As an ebis user, I want to see partner portal roster updates in their ebis player history
custom_expected:
The profile player history for professional (or employees) in ebis should show when the player is added or removed from a partner league roster.  

The short value will be "Partner Add" and "Partner Remove" and the description will read:
Player added to the <team> Roster of the <league>

where <team> and <league> are the appropriate leagues.

AC:
* When an existing ebis player is added to a partner roster there will be an appropriate line item in their player history
* When an existing ebis player is removed from a partner roster there will be an appropriate line item in their player history

title: As an ebis user, when viewing a partner portal player I want to see the partner portal contact info
custom_expected:
This story is dependent on https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1106

When viewing a partner portal person type in ebis (person_type_id = 8) the contact info displayed should be the partner portal info and not the actual person contact info tables.

Contact info consists of: Phone Numbers, Email Address, Addresses, National IDs and file attachments.

AC:
* When viewing a person_type_id of 8, contact info comes from the partner portal
* When viewing a person who is on a partner portal roster, but not of person_type_id 8 then continue to display the ebis contact information.

title: As a partner portal user, I want to open a profile in a new tab from the match modal
custom_expected:
When creating a new player if there are matches, right clicking should display an option to open the profile in a new tab/window.  
Wireframe: [https://zpl.io/ag1708Z|https://zpl.io/ag1708Z|smart-link] 

AC

* User can open profiles from the match modal in a new tab/window

title: As a partner portal user, I want club logos which don't exist to default to the league logo for which they belong
custom_expected:
AC:
* Display the league logo instead of a broken image for club logos when the club logo doesnt exist

title: As a partner portal user, I should only see contact information entered into the partner portal
custom_expected:
Partner portal users should not see contact information associated with existing MLB players.  Only information entered into the portal itself should be visible.  

Additionally, contact info for a player who is on a roster should only be visible to users for that club, league presidents for that league, or the overall league president super user (BOCs user).  Club users should not see contact info for other clubs players and league presidents cannot see contact info for other league's players.  This info should also be hidden in the response from the REST service: when using browser dev tools, it should not be visible in the response.

Contact info consists of: Phone Numbers, Email Address, Addresses, National IDs and file attachments.

Those sections should not be displayed on the screen when viewing a player who the user doesn't have permission to see.

Developer note:  Create new tables to mimic the existing contact tables for a person object (person_phone_number_assoc, person_email_address, person_address_assoc. person_profile_national_id, person_file_attachment_assoc)

AC:
* Contact info for partner portal players is specific to the partner portal and is not tied to the existing player info in ebis
* League presidents can only see contact info for players on rosters of their league
* Club users can only see contact info for players on their club's roster

title: As a BOC Admin, I want clubs to be prevented from creating requests for players who are unable to sign
custom_expected:
AC:

When a User attempts to create a new Partner League request, the system will perform a check to confirm they are able to sign a contract.

** i.e. Intl Amateurs who have not reached their ETSD / Reg requirements (person type id = 5)

** i.e. Dom Amas w/ remaining eligibility (person type id = 6)

If the player in question is unable to sign a contract, the system will return an error (blocker to Clubs, overridable warning for BOC)

** *Body:* "This player is not eligible to sign a contract. Please contact the BOC."

** *Buttons:* Ignore & Continue (BOC only), Back

title: As a developer I want the person_partner_info table to be keyed off of person_id
custom_expected:
We incorrectly created this table with its own primary key which is unnecessary. 
Lets update it and all places it is referenced so that person_id is the primary key

QA: for this, simple testing of creating/adding/viewing of players is all that will be necessary (so basically the rest of the stories working will suffice)

title: Improve scrolling on mobile
custom_expected:
The scrolling is a bit funky on a phone because the filters are fixed, making the scrollable content area on an actual device pretty small.  Are we able to put the filters in the same container as the rest of the content so everything below the fixed page header scrolls?

 !Screen Shot 2021-12-13 at 3.34.20 PM.png|thumbnail!

title: Styling Updates | PIVOTAL-1020
custom_expected:
Moved the below feedback out of https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1020 and into it's own bug.

5. All required fields that have not been filled out when the new profile loads should be outlined in red.  Iâ€™m not seeing Birth Country, Position, Bats or Throws outlined, but it has the required *.

6. The buttons should be save and cancel when creating a new player.  Iâ€™m seeing save and close.

7. The logo of the roster the player is being added should appear to the left of the name when the profile loads

8. The player header beneath the top nav should be fixed when scrolling and the buttons should be contained within the header.

9. The content of the player header and the profile should have left and right margins.  The content is currently up against either side of the browser window

10. Add spacing between all of the subsection (bio info, baseball info, etc)

11. Collapse/Expand section text (Bio Information, etc.) should be #4c8cee and font-size:1.125rem; (18px)

12. Subsection text (Primary Phone, Primary Email, etc.) should be font-weight:300;

13. Update the bottom border of the sections.  To get the double border with different colors I set the actual border to 1px solid #dee53d and then apply a box-shadow: white 0px 1px 0px; 

14. Do not display the table head for attached files if no files have been attached.

*Global*

* Change the hover color of nav links to #92a5ba and remove the underline

*Desktop*

* The active page in the top nav should have a background color of #083988
* Use a number instead of a % for the partner league logo so it doesnâ€™t move when resizing the window

*Mobile*

title: As a BOC user I want to make an unassigned partner portal user a league president
custom_preconds:
Unassigned partner portal users can be added to a 'league president role' which will also move them into the league presidents drop down.

The options will work just like the clubs do, there will be a list of the four leagues and a BOC option (which gives the user all leagues).
custom_steps: WHEN the user chooses to edit a user's permissions in the unassigned list
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a dropdown to add to a league president group that includes all partner leagues + BOC.
AND The user will be added to the league president group when a value is selected from the dropdown 
AND WHEN the "Save™ button is clicked, The saved user will be removed from the unassigned list and added to the League Presidents list.
AND If a user that is in a league president group is edited, there will be a button that can be clicked to remove that user from the group, 
AND they will be added to the unassigned list.

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to view a specific users Partner League Permissions
custom_preconds:
Wire: https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts&g=1

 - There will be two ways to view a specific users permissions, performing a new search or by selecting a user off an existing search
custom_steps: - When viewing a list of Partner League Users, the usernames will be a hyperlink
custom_expected:
THEN the usernames will be a hyperlink
AND Clicking the link will load that specific users permissions and will match the layout in the provided wire
AND If the user selects a specific username in the User dropdown, the Role dropdown will disappear
AND Clicking View with a specific username selected will load that specific users permissions and will match the layout in the provided wire
AND each user role assigned to the account will be expandable (collapses by default) and when expanded will display the individual groups associated with that role

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to view a list Partner League users and their permissions
custom_expected:
Wire: https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts&g=1

AC:
 - There will be a View button on the Partner League Users utility, as depicted
 - If Unassigned is selected as the League, Team is not displayed, and the list of users will reflect users that have not been assigned to a League or Team
 - If League Presidents is selected as the League, Team is not displayed, and the list of users will reflect users that have not been assigned to a Team
 - When All is selected in the Users dropdown, the Role dropdown will be visible
  -- Users can choose All to return all users will all roles or choose a specific role to view a list of all users with that role
 - Clicking View will perform a search based on the criteria selected in the dropdowns
 - Search results will display a list of all users matching the the criteria and the layout will match the provided wire

title: As a Club Admin, I want to create a contract from an Approved Request
custom_expected:
Wire: https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=partner_league_requests&g=1

AC:
 - When a PLP BOC Admin or a PLP Club Admin is viewing the Request widget in EBIS, there will be a 'Create Contract' button for any request in Approved state, as depicted
.  -- The user must have contract creation permissions.  If the user does not have MJC Admin or MNC Admin permissions, the button will not appear
 - Clicking the button will launch a tooltip, as depicted, which will function like a Create New menu
 - Inside the tool tip will be two buttons:
  -- Minor League Contract
  -- Major League Contract
 - Both of these buttons will function as if the user was using the global Create New menu to create a new contract
 - Once a contract is created and saved using this workflow, the button will be replaced with a hyperlink displaying the contractID and contract status
  -- Clicking the hyperlink will load the connected contract

title: As a Partner League Admin, I want requests to Expire
custom_expected:
Wires:

* PL Utility: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/61157b0b4e63099b430a28ef|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/61157b0b4e63099b430a28ef]
* EBIS Request widget: [https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=partner_league_requests&g=1|https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=partner_league_requests&g=1]

AC:

* Requests will expire 48 Hours after it becomes Accepted.
* If a Request is Approved, it will NOT be Expired.
* An Expired Request will no longer be editable and may not be approved.

title: As a Partner League Club Admin, I want to Approve a new request
custom_steps: WHEN a user is viewing the Request Utility
custom_expected:
THEN a user with the Partner League Club Admin role is viewing the Requests utility *for their own club*, they will see an Approve button on any request in Accepted state
AND a user with the Partner League President role is viewing the Requests utility *for their own league*, they will see an Approve button on any request in Accepted state
AND When a user with the PLP BOC Admin role is viewing the Requests utility *for any league*, they will see an Approve button on any request in Accepted state
AND Clicking the Approve button will launch the provided modal, prompting the user to confirm their action
AND There will be an Approve button and a Cancel button
AND Clicking Cancel will dismiss the modal
AND Clicking Approve will update the requests status to Approved, dismiss the modal, and display an Approved success message
AND When the request reaches Approved state, appropriate Email notifications (covered in separate story) will be sent out
AND When the request becomes Approved, the expiration date will be removed from the Request widget in both EBIS and the Portal.

title: As a BOC Admin, I want notifications to go out when a Request expires
custom_expected:
AC:

* When a Partner League request reaches Expired state, the system will generate a notification email
* The email will be sent to:
** Any EBIS users with the PLP BOC Admin
** Any EBIS users with the PLP Club Admin role for the MJ Org team that submitted the request
** Any users with the Partner League President role for the league the player is playing in
** Any users with the Partner League Club Admin role for the team the player is playing for
* The email will read as follows:
** Subject: Partner League Request Has Expired
** Body:  The Partner League Request submitted by \[MJ Submitting Org] on \[submission date of request] for \[Player Roster First, Last] of the \[Partner League Club Name] has expired.

title: As a Partner League EBIS Admin, I want to be notified when my submitted request has been Approved
custom_steps: WHEN a Partner League Request reaches an "Approved" state,
custom_expected:
THEN the system will generate a notification email
AND the email will be sent to the following: 
** Any EBIS users with the PLP BOC Admin
** Any EBIS users with the PLP Club Admin role for the MJ Org team that submitted the request
** Any users with the Partner League President role for the league the player is playing in
** Any users with the Partner League Club Admin role for the team the player is playing for

AND The email will read as follows:

** Subject: Partner League Request Has Been Approved
** Body:  The Partner League Request submitted by \[MJ Submitting Org] on \[submission date of request] for \[Player Roster First, Last] of the \[Partner League Club Name] has been approved.

title: As a Partner League Club Admin, I want to be notified when a new request is Accepted
custom_steps: WHEN a Partner League request reaches an Accepted state
custom_expected:
THEN the system will generate a notification email
AND the email will be sent to any users with the Partner League Club Admin role for the team the player is playing on
AND The email will read as follows:
** Subject: New Partner League Request
** Body:  A new Partner League request from the \[MJ Submitting Org] for \[Player Roster First, Last] has been accepted.  This request will expire in 48 hours.
Please log into the Partner League Portal to approve.

title: As a Partner League President, I want to be notified when a new request is submitted
custom_steps: WHEN a partner league request reaches a submitted state
custom_expected:
THEN the system will generate a notification email
AND the email will be sent to any users with the league president role for the league the player is playing in
AND the email will be sent to the BOC league president as well The email will also be sent to the BOC League President Role
AND the email will also be sent to the club user for the team (club admin and club user) 
AND the email will read as follows: 

** Subject: New Partner League Request
** Body:  The \[MJ Submitting Org] submitted a new Partner League Request on \[submission date of request] for \[Player Roster First, Last] of the \[Partner League Club Name].

Please log into the Partner League Portal to Accept.

title: As an EBIS User, I want to Cancel a Partner League Request from EBIS
custom_expected:
Wires:
 - https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=partner_league_requests&g=1
 - https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=cancel_request&g=1

AC:
 - Users with appropriate Admin permissions, will see a Cancel Request button in the Partner League Requests widget, as depicted
 - The Cancel Request button will only appear on requests that are Submitted, or Accepted, and have not yet expired
 - Clicking the button will launch a confirmation modal:
  -- Title: Are You Sure?
  -- Body: Are you sure you want to cancel the request for:
               [Player Name] - [POS] - [Team Name]
 - The modal will have a 'Yes' button and a 'No' button
 - Clicking the 'No' button will dismiss the modal and no further action will be taken
 - Clicking 'Yes' will update the request's status to Cancelled and remove the expiration date

title: As a Partner League Admin, I want Clubs to be stopped from creating requests for a player that already has an active request
custom_expected:
Wire:
 - https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=a_request_already_exists_for&g=1

AC:
 - Partner League players may only have one request active on them at a time. An Active Request is one that is Submitted or Accepted. If a player has an Approved request, another request can be made.
 - When a Club User clicks Submit Request, the system will perform a check to see if the selected player has a request with an expiration date in the future
 - If the player has a request that has not yet reached the expiration date, the system will return the following error:
  -- Title: Error
  -- Body: There is already a pending request for this player.  Please contact the BOC.
  -- Buttons: Back

title: As a Club User, I want to create a new Partner League Request
custom_steps: WHEN users are viewing the Partner League Requests widget
custom_expected:
THEN Admin users will see a "New Request" button in the footer of the Partner League Requests widget
AND Clicking the button will launch the New Request modal
AND There will be a Cancel button on the modal
AND Clicking Cancel will dismiss the modal
AND There will be a Player search box
AND The Player box will be an autocompleter that is populated with *all* players currently appearing on Partner League Team Rosters
AND Selecting a player from the autocompleter will activate the Submit Request button
AND Clicking "Submit Request" will:
  -- Submit the request
  -- Dismiss the modal
  -- Display a blue "Submitted" success popup
AND The new request will be displayed in both the Partner League Requests widget in ebis and the Requests dashboard in the Partner League Portal

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to view the Requests Dashboard in the Partner League Portal
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a Requests link, as depicted
AND Clicking Requests will load the Requests dashboard
AND The dashboard will match the provided wire and data discovery
AND The icons in the left nav will continue serving as a filter for the data displayed on the page
AND Clicking American Assoc will display American Assoc data, etc.
AND Club users will only see request data pertaining to their club
AND League Presidents will see all request data for their League, but no data for other Leagues
AND A BOC User would see all request data across leagues

title: As a BOC Admin User, I want to create a Partner League Team that will appear in the portal
custom_expected:
Leagues and DIvisions: https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2165506053/Partner+Leagues+and+Teams

AC:
 - BOC Users with the correct permissions will be able to create a new team for the Partner Leagues

  -- Pioneer League

 - When the club is created, it will visible in both the Partner League Portal and in ebis

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to View a Player's Profile
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks a player's name throughout the portal
custom_expected:
THEN it will open the player's profile

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to View/Edit a Player's Profile
custom_steps: WHEN a player's name is displayed in the portal
custom_expected:
THEN it will be a hyperlink to the profile
 -- Roster widgets, Request widgets, etc
AND Clicking the player's name will open the player's profile
AND Users with permission to edit the player's profile will see a the profile open as an editable form
AND There will be a 'Close' button and a 'Save' button
AND The Save button will be inactive until a user makes any edits to the form
AND If the save button is clicked, the form will be updated, committing any changes to the DB, a success notification will be displayed, and the Save button will become inactive again
AND If there are unsaved changes on the form, and Close is clicked, the user will be asked to confirm their actions"
AND Clicking Cancel will bring the user back to the unsaved form
AND Clicking Continue will dismiss the changes and return the user to their entry point
AND If there no unsaved changes on the form and Close is clicked, the user will be returned to their entry point without any prompting or modals

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to remove a player from a roster
custom_expected:
THEN users with the appropriate permissions will see a Trash Can icon next to each player's name, as depicted in the provided wire
AND Clicking the icon will launch the provided "Remove player from roster' modal
AND There will be a 'Remove Player' and 'Cancel' button on the modal
AND Clicking the 'Cancel' button will dismiss the modal and return the user to the team's roster
AND Clicking 'Remove Player' will remove the selected player from the roster, dismiss the modal, and return the user to the team's roster page
AND A green 'Removed' success message will also be displayed

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want the system to check if a new players exists in EBIS or is a non-active portal player
custom_expected:
Wires:
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112d6a6c892069ca752bd8c
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112bfea522ffe9bd1baaf0a

AC:
 - When the user enters the 4 required matching fields and clicks the "Create New Player" button, the system will perform a match check to see if the player exists in EBIS or if they are an inactive Partner League player
 - If a player is found, the system will return the provided matching modal
 - There will be a 'Continue Creating New Player' and a 'Cancel' button
 - Clicking 'Cancel' will dismiss the modal and return the user to the New Player screen
 - Clicking "Continue...' will bring the user to a new player profile and allow them to continue creating the new player
 - There will also be an 'Add to Roster" button, as depicted
 - Clicking the 'Add to Roster' button will place the matching player profile on the appropriate team's roster, dismiss the modal, and bring the user to the team's roster page
 - The system will also display  a green success notification, as depicted

 - Clicking 'Cancel' will dismiss the modal and return the user to the New Player screen

title: Partner League Portal - Birth Date entered displays incorrectly

# create player
# enter all required info - 
# view Birth Date field in the following player profile, matching modals, roster widget (any place Birth Date field is visible)

expected: Birth Date throughout PLP matches the Birth Date entered during Create New process

actual: birth date value = birth date entered minus one day
